com.avaya.cmapi.callinformation

Interface CallInformationServices


  • public interface CallInformationServices
    Allows applications to get detailed call information and to determine the status of the call information links. The call information link must be operational to get the call information. The call information link is one of the communication links between the Communication Manager and the Application Enablement Services server.

    Prerequisites Before you use CallInformationServices, you must do the following:

    1. Obtain and register a device ID for the extension or phone you wish to get information about. Use DeviceServices to obtain a device ID. It is required for the switch name to be populated in the device ID. This can be accomplished by either specifying it explicitly in the GetDeviceID request or by properly administering the H.323 Gatekeeper list. See the Programmers Guide for more details.
    2. Optionally use RegistrationServices to register the device.
    3. Obtain a CallInformationServices object by invoking the ServiceProvider.getService() method. For example, your code might look like this: 
       CallInformationServices callInfoSvcs =
   (CallInformationServices)csta.getService(CallInformationServices.class.getName());
    4. Implement and add a CallInformationListener using the addCallInformationListener method to monitor changes in CM link status.

    Clean Up After you are finished using this service, do the following:

    1. Remove any listeners you added by using the removeCallInformationListener method.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.6 $
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

    • Method Detail

      • getCallInformation

        GetCallInformationResponse getCallInformation(GetCallInformation request)
                                       throws CstaException
        Get detailed information about the active call on the specified device. The requested call information is returned in the GetCallInformationResponse.

        Note that this operation was specifically designed to work with a call recording scenario where service observing is being used as the recording mechanism. When the call involves a single station (e.g. agent) being recorded using service observing, the recordingExtension, agentLoginId and agentName fields will always be those for station being observed / recorded.

        When invoked in scenarios other than the above, the results may be unexpected. The following are some examples of alternate scenarios.

        In a scenario where the call involves an external (Trunk) caller talking to an internal Communication Manager controlled station (e.g. agent), the recordingExtension, agentLoginId and agentName will be those for the internal station.

        In a scenario where there are two internal stations talking with each other the recordingExtension, agentLoginId and agentName fields will be those for the CALLING station, regardless of which extension (calling or called party) is provided in the request.

        Parameters:
        request - specifies the desired call by the DeviceID of a registered device.
        Returns:
        detailed information about the active call on the device in the GetCallInformationResponse structure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if CallInformationRequest is null, if the DeviceID within the CallInformationRequest is null, or if the content within the DeviceID is null.
        OperationException - if the call information link is down or if there were any kind of I/O problems during the requests across the call information link.
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • getLinkStatus

        GetLinkStatusResponse getLinkStatus(GetLinkStatus request)
                             throws CstaException
        Gets the status of the call information link to the media server.

        The requested link status is returned in the GetLinkStatusResponse.

        The following code shows an example of how to request the status of all links and how to process the resulting response: 

         GetLinkStatus request = new GetLinkStatus();
 // With no link name supplied in the request, gets status for all links
 GetLinkStatusResponse response = callInfoSvcs.getLinkStatus(request);
 for (int i = 0; i < response.getLinkList().length; i++) {
     LinkStatus linkStatus = response.getLinkList(i);
     log.info("Link status for link " + linkStatus.getLinkName() +
         " linkUp = " + linkStatus.getIsLinkUp() +
         " autoReconnect = " + linkStatus.getAutoReconnect());
     }
        As shown below, it is also possible to request the link status of the call information link for a specific switch. This is accomplished by specifying the switch name as administered through the Web OAM pages. 
         GetLinkStatus request = new GetLinkStatus();
 request.setLinkName("MySwitch");
 GetLinkStatusResponse response = callInfoSvcs.getLinkStatus(request);
 LinkStatus linkStatus = response.getLinkList(0);
 if (linkStatus.getIsLinkUp())
           ...

        Parameters:
        request - optionally specifies the name of the link for which to retrieve status.
        Returns:
        GetLinkStatusResponse status information about the requested link(s)
        Throws:
        OperationException - if an incorrect link name is specified
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • addCallInformationListener

        void addCallInformationListener(CallInformationListener listener)
                         throws CstaException
        Adds a listener to monitor for changes in status of all Call Information Links. To be notified of any status change on the call information links, your application must provide a class that implements CallInformationListener with an implementation of every callback method in the CallInformationListener interface. See the CallInformationListener for the types of events that your application can be notified of. To learn more about using listeners, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

        If multiple listeners are added, then each listener will be notified of changes to call infromation link status; the corresponding callback will be called on each listener that has been added. If the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.

        Parameters:
        listener - the CallInformationListener implementation to be added
        Throws:
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeCallInformationListener

        void removeCallInformationListener(CallInformationListener listener)
                            throws CstaException
        Removes the indicated listener so that it no longer receives notifications of call information link status changes.

        It is possible for a callback to be issued on a listener after it has been removed. If no listeners have been added, then nothing happens when an event occurs. If the specified listener is not one that was previously added or is null, then no exception is thrown and no function is performed.

        Parameters:
        listener - the CallInformationListener implementation to be removed
        Throws:
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • getSIPHeader

        GetSIPHeaderResponse getSIPHeader(GetSIPHeader request)
                           throws CstaException
        Gets the proprietary customer inforamtion of a SIP call on the specified device. The inbound SIP call can carry addtional user information within the "Call-Info" hearder or MIME body of the SIP INVITE message. Avaya Communication Manager will store the user information for each SIP call. This on-demand request will retrieve the SIP customer information of a particular call indicating by the DeviceID and ButtonID. The requested SIP customer information will be returned in the GetSIPHeaderResponse. NOTE: The license SA8889 or SA8891 will be required on Avaya Communication Manager to enable this feature.

        Parameters:
        request - specifies the desired call by the DeviceID and ButtonID of a registered device.
        Returns:
        SIP header data of the active call on the device in the GetSIPHEaderResponse structure.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if SIPHeaderRequest is null, if the DeviceID within the SIPHeaderRequest is null, or if the content withing the DeviceID is null.
        OperationException - if the call information link is down or if there were any kind of I/O problems during the requests across the call information link.
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • addSIPHeaderListener

        void addSIPHeaderListener(DeviceID device,
                          SIPHeaderListener listener)
                   throws CstaException
        Adds a listener that monitors the SIP customer information of the new arrival SIP call on a specified device. The inbound SIP call can carry addtional user information within the "Call-Info" hearder or MIME body of the SIP INVITE message. Avaya Communication Manager will store the user information for each SIP call and send it to AES if the call is terminated on a monitored device. To be notified of the SIP customer information on a call, your application must provide a class that implements SIPHeaderListener with an implementation of the callback method in the CallInformationListener interface. See the SIPHeaderListener for the types of events that your application can be notified of. To learn more about using listeners, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API. NOTE: The license SA8889 or SA8891 will be required on Avaya Communication Manager to enable this feature.

        If multiple listeners are added to monitor on the same device, then each listener will be notified of the retrieval SIP customer information; the corresponding callback will be called on each listener that has been added. If the specified listener is null, no exception is thrown and no action is performed.

        Parameters:
        device - the device to which the SIPHeaderListern is applied
        listener - the SIPHeaderListener implementation to be added
        Throws:
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs

      • removeSIPHeaderListener

        void removeSIPHeaderListener(SIPHeaderListener listener)
                      throws CstaException
        Removes the indicated listener so that it no longer receives notifications of the SIP customer information. NOTE: The license SA8889 or SA8891 will be required on Avaya Communication Manager to enable this feature.

        It is possible for a callback to be issued on a listener after it has been removed. If no listeners have been added, then nothing happens when an event occurs. If the specified listener is not one that was previously added or is null, then no exception is thrown and no function is performed.

        Parameters:
        listener - the SIPHeaderListener implementation to be removed
        Throws:
        CstaException - if an implementation-specific exception occurs
